Main roads that enter the Salisbury area are I-95, Route 1, and route 110. 

The nearest bus station is called C&J Bus Lines and it is located a town over in Newburyport, MA. (C&J buses offer complimentary WI-FI connection).
''Newburyport, MA 
90 Storey Avenue, 01950
Conveniently located off I-95 (Exit 57) and Route 113''

The nearest airport to the Salisbury area is the Boston Logan International Airport.
The MBTA commuter rail makes a stop in Newburyport, MA a town over.
The nearest boat entry to the town is from the mouth of the Merrimack River which separates Salisbury from the Newburyport/Plum Island area. There is docking available along the river.

Salisbury Beach fireworks every Saturday night at 9pm during the summer! The entire beach fills with people waiting to see the show. While people wait they listen to music (sometimes live), play arcade games, enjoy pizza, ice cream, cotton candy, and enjoy each other's company on the waterfront.

value: content=The beach is lifeguard protected from Memorial Day to Labor day, weather permitting. Unless you are staying in the town of Salisbury it may be more convenient to use the state park (Salisbury Beach State Reservation, $9 entry fee Memorial Weekend through Labor Day) to access the beach since they offer a large parking area, bathrooms and outdoor showers.

Salisbury’s beachfront is the perfect place to take a long walk and enjoy all the beach has to offer allowing beach goers a place to enjoy summer activities like sun tanning, snorkeling, and boogey boarding. Some other attractions include Joe’s Play Land Arcade, physic readings, and many small shops.

Being a summer hot spot the majority of small stores along the beachfront sell merchandise like sunglasses, towels, sunscreen, shell necklaces, and bathing suits. These stores are fun to walk around through offering endless types of candy and toys anyone would enjoy!

Seaglass is a fancy restaurant located on Salisbury beach about two minutes walking distance from the square. Seaglass offers a vast dining room with large windows overlooking the oceans shore. The menu offers seafood’s and steak house selections.

Lena’s Seafood (located about 10 minutes from the beachfront without traffic) is an order at the counter, take your number, chose your own booth kind of restaurant and the locals wouldn’t have it any other way. Very popular during the summer seasons people travel from all around to order Lena’s popular fried seafood dishes, famous battered onion rings, and delicious fish and clam chowder. Almost everything is fried so if you’re looking for anything baked or grilled you’re at the wrong place.

Don’t leave without ordering a slice of beach pizza from Cristy’s Pizza! The thin crust, square shaped pizza is wildly popular and sold by the slice. If you’re a cheese lover you might want to order yours with extra cheese since it’s mostly sauce but even that is still delicious depending on your preference.
, located a few miles to the north, has additional lodging options.

value: content=Their food ranges from Seafood to Steaks.

content=The state park in Salisbury is open during the summer. It offers camping (484 sites) and beach access.
